snippet: Rabies kills 24,000 people a year in Africa because many people with the disease cannot afford the cost of the vaccine, experts of the disease said Thursday.
abstract: Rabies kills 24,000 people a year in Africa, most of them children, because many people with disease cannot afford cost of the vaccine; vaccine costs about $13 per injection.
lead_paragraph: Rabies kills 24,000 people a year in Africa because many people with the disease cannot afford the cost of the vaccine, experts of the disease said Thursday.

headline.main: Rabies Deaths Linked to Cost of Vaccine
headline.print_headline: Rabies Deaths Linked to Cost of Vaccine
